Description: A copper bodkin: of square section, tapering to a pointed tip. At the top of the blade the metal has been hammered to form a narrow rod, looped over at the end. Surface corroded.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: W. B. Emery, 'Great tombs of the First Dynasty; excavations at Sakkara' III (London, 1958), 50, no. 7 or 9. For similar objects of Early Dynastic date, see W. B. Emery, 'Great tombs of the First Dynasty; excavations at Sakkara' I' (Cairo, 1949), 48-9 and pl.9B; W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, pls.XXXVIII, 92; XLIII, 17; Z. Y. Saad, 'The excavations at Helwan art and civilization in the first and second Egyptian dynasties' (Norman, 1969), pl.37; E. Amélineau, ‘Les Nouvelles Fouilles d’Abydos’ III, (1897-8), pl.VIII, 15.
